metadata.title: CVE-2023-24023 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Bluetooth BR/EDR devices with Secure Simple Pairing and Secure Connectionspairing in Bluetooth Core Specification 4.2 through 5.4 allow certainman-in-the-middle attacks that force a short key length, and might lead todiscovery of the encryption key and live injection, aka BLUFFS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-24023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-253-generic - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-253-generic - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-253-lowlatency - 4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1130-aws - 4.4.0-1130.136
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1176-azure - 4.15.0-1176.191~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-253.287~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1130.136').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1176.191~14.04.1').
